channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump pardons disgraced former Illinois Gov. Rod Blagojevich
item.description: Blagojevich was convicted on corruption charges for trying to sell a Senate seat once held by President Obama. Trump commuted his sentence in 2020.
item.content:encoded:
Blagojevich was convicted on corruption charges for trying to sell a Senate seat once held by President Obama. Trump commuted his sentence in 2020.

(Image credit: Scott Olson)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: Bill Gates reflects on his youth, beginnings of Microsoft, in new memoir
item.description: In his new memoir, "Source Code," billionaire philanthropist Bill Gates opens up about his adolescence and early adult life.
item.content:encoded:
In his new memoir, "Source Code," billionaire philanthropist Bill Gates opens up about his adolescence and early adult life.

(Image credit: Mitra Arthur)
item.dc:creator: Noah Caldwell

item.title: Congress now has a DOGE Caucus. Here's how its co-chair says it will work
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Rep. Pete Sessions, co-chair of the House DOGE Caucus, on how he plans to work with the Department of Government Efficiency.
item.content:encoded:
NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Rep. Pete Sessions, co-chair of the House DOGE Caucus, on how he plans to work with the Department of Government Efficiency.

(Image credit: Jason Andrew)
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly

item.title: Trump's ban on gender-affirming care for young people puts hospitals in a bind
item.description: Hospitals and clinics that have offered gender-affirming treatments to transgender youth reacted in a variety of ways to an executive order that aims to halt the care.
item.content:encoded:
Hospitals and clinics that have offered gender-affirming treatments to transgender youth reacted in a variety of ways to an executive order that aims to halt the care.

(Image credit: Stephanie Keith)
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin

item.title: Bryan Adams concert in Australia is canceled after a 'fatberg' causes sewage overflow
item.description: The blockage was detected near a Perth arena mere hours before Canadian musician Bryan Adams' sold-out show was set to take place. Water authorities warned of wastewater overflow at the venue.
item.content:encoded:
The blockage was detected near a Perth arena mere hours before Canadian musician Bryan Adams' sold-out show was set to take place. Water authorities warned of wastewater overflow at the venue.

(Image credit: Adrian Dennis)
item.dc:creator: Manuela López Restrepo

item.title: Salman Rushdie wrote about his attempted murder. Now he will face his attacker in court
item.description: Hadi Matar, who is on trial for the knife attack against the British author, has also been accused of supporting terrorism and attempting to carry out a fatwa calling for Rushdie's assassination.
item.content:encoded:
Hadi Matar, who is on trial for the knife attack against the British author, has also been accused of supporting terrorism and attempting to carry out a fatwa calling for Rushdie's assassination.

(Image credit: Cesar Luis de Luca)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: NEW MEXICO BOOK BILL
item.description: Some New Mexico lawmakers are crafting a bill that would withhold state funding from public libraries that remove books for certain reasons — shielding librarians from outside influence.
item.content:encoded: Some New Mexico lawmakers are crafting a bill that would withhold state funding from public libraries that remove books for certain reasons — shielding librarians from outside influence.
item.dc:creator: Nash Jones

item.title: The Trump administration has stopped work at the CFPB. Here's what the agency does
item.description: It's the main U.S. agency tasked with overseeing the financial products and services used by everyday Americans. The CFPB's new head has closed its offices and told staff to stay home.
item.content:encoded:
It's the main U.S. agency tasked with overseeing the financial products and services used by everyday Americans. The CFPB's new head has closed its offices and told staff to stay home.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: What DOGE could mean for Medicare and Medicaid?
item.description:
Elon Musk's Department of Government Efficiency is quickly expanding its reach through the federal government.

It recently accessed systems at the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services. Musk and his team now are looking at key payment and contracting systems for Medicare and Medicaid.

That was first reported by the Wall Street Journal.

On X, Musk said he believes quote "big money fraud is happening."

Medicare insures older people. Medicaid offers insurance to low income people and those with disabilities.

These two health insurance programs serve tens of millions of people, and they consume a huge part of federal and state budgets. So how could DOGE impact these services?

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org

Email us at considerthis@npr.org
item.content:encoded:
Elon Musk's Department of Government Efficiency is quickly expanding its reach through the federal government.

It recently accessed systems at the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services. Musk and his team now are looking at key payment and contracting systems for Medicare and Medicaid.

That was first reported by the Wall Street Journal.

On X, Musk said he believes quote "big money fraud is happening."

Medicare insures older people. Medicaid offers insurance to low income people and those with disabilities.

These two health insurance programs serve tens of millions of people, and they consume a huge part of federal and state budgets. So how could DOGE impact these services?

item.title: What USAID Cuts Look Like Overseas
item.description: The Trump administration is dismantling the United States Agency for International Development, USAID. They had been doing humanitarian work in more than 100 countries. We hear from NPR correspondents around the world about what the agency had been doing on the ground and what it's elimination could mean.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration is dismantling the United States Agency for International Development, USAID. They had been doing humanitarian work in more than 100 countries. We hear from NPR correspondents around the world about what the agency had been doing on the ground and what it's elimination could mean.
item.dc:creator: Joanna Kakissis
